content.prompt: Which of the following best describes the position on the value of private charity seen in the two passages?

choices.label: Raudot claims that relying on private charity will have a positive social outcome, whereas the weavers imply that private charity is insufficient to address their needs.
Raudot claims that relying on private charity will have a positive social outcome, and the weavers share this position.
Raudot claims that private charity is destructive to social relationships, whereas the weavers see it as valuable.
Raudot and the weaversâ€™ union both agree that private charity is destructive to social relationships.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Compare the arguments or main ideas of two sources.
